alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Central Brewster County; Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Dawson; Gaines; Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 28 at 2:16AM CDT until October 30 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 29 possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast New Mexico and southwest and western Texas. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
